 [‹ (x) Spinal Tap logo - custom designed {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024954/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35825 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a serif face similar to the Chloe type signature ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409024954/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35388 "Go to next forum topic")
author: zyra7

comments.content:
It has an Art Nouveau feeling, but the closest genuine typeface from that era I found that was similar was called Fantasie Noire from Peignot (shown in Petzendorfer’s book in Plate 32). However, it is not any more than similar. My guess is that this may have been inspired by Art Nouveau, but may be custom drawn for this logo. (In other words, I do not recognize it as a font I have seen.)

- Mike Yanega
Looks quite amateurish — could be a freeware font.
